abstractText: Four new alkylamides named retroframides A-D (1-4) together with twenty-two known compounds were isolated from the fruits of Piper rectrofractum. The structures of new compounds were elucidated on the basis of spectroscopic data including 2D NMR and chemical derivatization followed by GC-MS analysis. Of isolated compounds, piperine (25) and pellitorine (26) revealed moderate inhibition against tyrosinase with percentage inhibition of 36.1 and 40.7. List of supplementary material Figure S1. HPLC chromatogram of compounds 1 and 4 Figure S2. HPLC chromatogram of compounds 2 and 3 Figure S3. MS spectrum of compound 1 Figure S4. H NMR spectrum of compound 1 Figure S5. C NMR spectrum of compound 1 Figure S6. COSY spectrum of compound 1 Figure S7. HSQC spectrum of compound 1 Figure S8. HMBC spectrum of compound 1 Figure S9. Key HMBC (→) and H-H COSY (bold lines) correlations of compound 1 Table S1. The H, C NMR, COSY and HMBC data of compound 1 in CDCl3 Figure S10. MS spectrum of compound 2 Figure S11. H NMR spectrum of compound 2 Figure S12. C NMR spectrum of compound 2 Figure S13. COSY spectrum of compound 2 Figure S14. HSQC spectrum of compound 2 Figure S15. HMBC spectrum of compound 2 Table S2. The H, C NMR, COSY and HMBC data of compound 2 in CDCl3 Figure S16. MS spectrum of compound 3 Figure S17. H NMR spectrum of compound 3 Figure S18. C NMR spectrum of compound 3 Figure S19. COSY spectrum of compound 3 Figure S20. HSQC spectrum of compound 3 Figure S21. HMBC spectrum of compound 3 Table S3. The H, C NMR, COSY and HMBC data of compound 3 in CDCl3 Figure S22. MS spectrum of compound 4 Figure S23. H NMR spectrum of compound 4 Figure S24. C NMR spectrum of compound 4 Figure S25. COSY spectrum of compound 4 Figure S26. HSQC spectrum of compound 4 Figure S27. HMBC spectrum of compound 4 Table S4. The H, C NMR, COSY and HMBC data of compound 4 in CDCl3 Figure S28. H NMR spectra of compounds 1-4 Figure S29. C NMR spectra of compounds 1-4 Figure S30. GC-MS analysis of isolated double bond of compound 1

sections.text:
Four new alkylamides named retroframides A-D (1-4) together with twenty-two known
compounds were isolated from the fruits of Piper rectrofractum. The structures of new compounds
were elucidated on the basis of spectroscopic data including 2D NMR and chemical derivatization
followed by GC-MS analysis. Of isolated compounds, piperine (25) and pellitorine (26) revealed
moderate inhibition against tyrosinase with percentage inhibition of 36.1 and 40.7.

title: Four new alkylamides from the fruits of Piper retrofractum and antityrosinase evaluation
